column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////We were seated upstairs.  It is pretty loud and they play only one or two songs over and over again.  The decor is non existent.  The waitress was very nice and attentive.  The house salad looked good
column2: and had a variety of vegetables
column3: but was pretty bland tasting.  We chose the "Lou" deep dish vegetarian pizza.  It was good and had a decent crust
column4: but I've had better.  The price was very good; $22 for a medium that three people struggled to finish two slices each.  For me it didn't live up to the hype of best deep dish pizza
column5: or at least I hope Chicago has better.  However
column6: if you are looking for reasonably priced
